messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Susan, John Holt, Ferris
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/14/2002 12:29:01 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Ferris Bueller. Up there in the top ten movies I can watch again and again and again---but
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/14/2002 12:29:01 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:
> Marty and I just watched Ferris Bueller's Day Off and the teachers are
> caricatures of teachers, but each and every bit was something I had seen
> done, maybe just not all at once. <g>

Ferris Bueller. Up there in the top ten movies I can watch again and again
and again---but last night I couldn't watch it. ;-( We had twenty Lovejoys
here for the Lovejoy Christmas party all day. (a whole 'nother post! <G>)

Last night, I made the same statement about Best In Show. The dog show folk
are stereotypical caricatures, and each and every bit was something I'd seen
(and done! <G>)---and maybe and maybe NOT all at once! <G> It's a little
snapshot of my "doggy" life. When you see it smushed together into a two hour
flick, it's hard to believe I'm out there in it---but that's my doggy life.

Pam? <G>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
